text:
whhen i trying to configure apahce with --enable systemd.
it will not compile the module.

so i found a solution that's works finaliy
do patch:
http://files.directadmin.com/services/custombuild/2.0/custombuild/configure/systemd/dependencies/httpd-2.4.10-systemd.patch

remove current configure
then ruun:
autoconf --force

and compile , mac and make install
will compile mod_systemd.so

pls apache, fix this issue without any patches.

using centos 7 last version

thanks

text:
Marking as enhancement. mod_systemd isn't part of this release, it's not
a bug, much less a critical one, that it doens't build. The patch
is the entire module.
creator: covener@gmail.com
ben@hakim.co.il
text:
it's all the versions. it's should be fixed..
why you think it's not a major or critical if it's not working ?

(In reply to ben from comment #2)
> it's all the versions. it's should be fixed..
> why you think it's not a major or critical if it's not working ?

I don't know how else I can express it -- it's simply not a bug that our release doesn't contain a module that you want.

Adding a module is an enhancement. I was trying to be diplomatic by not closing the bug outright.
